ratings.comment: Took two classes by this professor. Clearly states what you need to know. You'll do well if you attend class and read the recommended book sections.

Great professor. Pacing was pretty slow, but more examples is better than too few. Otherwise lectures were informative and laidback, with jokes thrown in here and there. Homework is long but rarely redundant/is always helpful to learning the material. Exams were very fair. Definitely take a class with Professor Harron if you can
Be prepared to do a lot of work. Homeworks are quite long, but help you learn the material. He's open to questions and helpful if you go to his office hours.

Keeping in mind that this was hand down the most difficult class I have taken to date, Harron did a very effective job of teaching this very challenging material. He is very approachable and has a likable demeanor and sense of humor. The exams are difficult but not as difficult as most of the homework.

A great professor. After teaching a new concept, he works a lot of example on the board to make sure we understand. He also will spend multiple days on harder topics which helps. His tests aren't too bad as long as you understand the homework.

I was extremely nervous about taking Math 217 because Calculus was not exactly one of my strong points but Professor Harron made it very understandable. He is a great lecturer who explains things with words you can understand instead complicated math language. He lectures at a perfect pace and his tests reflect exactly what is said in lecture.

I had never taken calc in high school and managed to get an A in this class.  It did take a lot of work on my part, but Professor Harron really makes an effort to clear everything up and show plenty of examples. The book was confusing, but he made it better (although he did show a lot of pointless proofs)

Very good professor. He brought a cheerful attitude to lecture, and did a good job clarifying a confusing textbook. Sometimes showed some long-winded proofs that seemed pointless. Test were very fair, and somewhat on the easy side.

I took calc in high school, so this class was fairly easy. Still, Professor Harron is a fantastic teacher. He makes everything clear and easy to understand. The homework isn't bad, and his midterms and final were super easy. He's a funny guy and makes math actually fun and interesting. Makes you want to come to lecture. Great class.

Excellent professor. He made the class somewhat interesting, and the homework load wasn't too bad. I didn't take calc and high school, and i was still able to learn the material and get decent grades. Although, it was annoying to see people who already took calc not do as much studying.

literally Just took is final today. I don't think the class was very hard but then again I did take Calc In high school. Classes aren't the most interesting but it is math so I wasn't expecting stand up comedy. Got a B on my first midterm and an A on second midterm. Final was a little rocky but if you take the time to study you should be fine.
Such a great professor. Explains things so well and he is a funny guy for sure. Tests are fair, their tough but he doesnt do anything wild. Definitely wish I was taking him for Math222.

He is a pretty funny guy, and he does a lot of examples to get a better understanding of the material. He does pointless proofs, but other than that I would recommend him. I am not very good at math, but his exams are very fair.
Young, clear speaker, funny, and keeps you awake. Everything you could want in a math professor.

He is a very good professor, very clear and understanding. The subject is very difficult, but he basically takes the textbook and clarifies it and dumbs it down. I wouldn't say he's fantastic, but very good compared to other teachers.

He is a very good professor, He is normally clear about what he says in the class and has a very good grasp of the material. He likes to induce interest in his class by showing practical examples of how these math concepts are put to use in real life. He does do a lot of unnecessary examples and proofs in the class though.
